digital-experience-healthcare/contact.ht.overview: The contact page for Digital Experience Healthcare provides navigation, contact information, and a form submission interface with success and error banners. It includes accessibility features, theme toggling, and structured content for user inquiries.
key_components: Sticky navigation bar with theme toggle
Hero section with title and subtitle
Contact form (implied but not shown in snippet)
interactions: Click skip-to-content link to jump to main content
Toggle dark/light theme via theme-toggle button
Navigate between pages using navbar links
Submit contact form to trigger success or error banners
Dismiss banners using banner-close buttons
data_flow: User fills contact form and submits
Frontend validates input and sends data to backend endpoint (not shown)
On success, hides form and displays success banner
On failure, displays error banner with retry guidance
User can dismiss banners manually
accessibility: Skip link for keyboard navigation
ARIA roles for navigation and alerts
aria-live regions for dynamic banners
aria-labels on interactive elements (theme toggle, banner close)
Semantic headings and landmarks
test_ideas: Verify skip-to-content link focuses main content
Validate navbar links navigate correctly and active state updates
Test theme toggle persists preference across reloads
Submit valid form and assert success banner visibility and aria-live announcement
Submit invalid form and assert error banner visibility
Ensure banner close buttons hide banners and restore focus appropriately
Check all interactive elements have accessible names and roles
Confirm analytics events fire on key interactions

digital-experience-healthcare/index.html.overview: The Digital Experience Healthcare homepage provides a responsive, accessible landing page with navigation, hero content, and introductory sections promoting healthcare services. It includes navigation links, theme toggle, and call-to-action buttons leading to other pages.
key_components: Sticky navigation bar with brand and menu
Hero section with title, description, and CTAs
interactions: Clicking navigation links routes to Home, More Information, or Contact pages
Theme toggle button switches between light and dark modes
Skip to content link focuses main content for accessibility
CTA buttons navigate to service and contact pages
data_flow: Static HTML content rendered directly from index.html
Navigation links trigger full page reloads to other static routes
Theme toggle likely updates DOM class or attribute to persist theme state
No dynamic data fetching or API calls observed
accessibility: Skip link for keyboard navigation
ARIA labels on navigation and buttons
Semantic headings and landmarks (header, main, section, article)
Alt attributes on images (decorative image marked aria-hidden)
Proper use of aria-current and aria-pressed states
analytics: Potential click tracking on nav links and CTA buttons
Page view tracking on route changes
test_ideas: Verify skip-to-content link moves focus to main content
Validate navigation links route correctly and highlight active page
Check theme toggle updates aria-pressed and visual theme
Ensure hero CTAs navigate to correct pages
Confirm all interactive elements are keyboard accessible
Validate responsive layout across viewport sizes
Check meta tags and title for SEO compliance
Verify no accessibility violations using axe-core

digital-experience-healthcare/main.js.overview: Framework-free JavaScript powering interactive healthcare website features including theme toggling, back-to-top behavior, analytics logging, and a debug panel for event inspection.
interactions: Click theme toggle to switch between light and dark modes
Keyboard activation of theme toggle via Enter or Space
Scroll triggers visibility of back-to-top button
Click back-to-top button to smooth scroll to top
Ctrl+Shift+D toggles debug panel visibility
routes: No explicit routes; operates on single-page frontend behaviors
data_flow: Theme preference stored and retrieved from localStorage
Analytics events appended to window.analyticsLog array
Debug panel reads last 20 analytics events for display
Scroll position determines back-to-top button visibility
accessibility: Theme toggle includes keyboard support (Enter, Space)
Reduced motion respected via prefers-reduced-motion media query
Back-to-top button visibility and focus should be tested for screen readers
analytics: logAnalytics(type, payload) pushes events to window.analyticsLog
theme_toggle event logged with selected theme
test_ideas: Verify theme toggle updates data-theme attribute and localStorage value
Ensure theme toggle is keyboard accessible
Confirm back-to-top button visibility toggles after scrolling past threshold
Validate smooth scroll behavior respects reduced motion setting
Trigger Ctrl+Shift+D and confirm debug panel displays recent analytics events
Check analyticsLog entries for correct event type and timestamp format
Simulate multiple theme toggles and verify analytics event count and payload accuracy

digital-experience-healthcare/more-info..overview: The 'More Information' page of Digital Experience Healthcare provides users with search, filter, and sort capabilities to explore healthcare services. It includes a navigation bar, accessibility features, and dynamic service card placeholders for loading states.
key_components: Sticky navigation bar with theme toggle
Page header with title and subtitle
interactions: Clicking navigation links to switch pages
Toggling dark mode via theme toggle button
Typing in search input to filter services
Clicking filter chips to apply category filters
Selecting sort options to reorder results
data_flow: User input in search field triggers filtering of service cards
Filter chip selection updates displayed services by category
Sort dropdown changes order of displayed services
Skeleton loaders replaced by fetched service data once available
accessibility: Skip link for keyboard navigation
ARIA roles and labels on navigation and controls
Visually hidden labels for search input
aria-pressed states on toggle and filter chips
aria-current on active navigation link
analytics: Track search input usage and query terms
Track filter chip selections and combinations
test_ideas: Verify skip-to-content link focuses main content
Validate navigation links route correctly and active state updates
Ensure theme toggle updates aria-pressed and visual theme
Test search input filters visible service cards dynamically
Confirm filter chips toggle aria-pressed and filter results
Validate sort dropdown reorders service cards correctly
Check skeleton loaders are replaced by service cards after data load
Run accessibility audit for ARIA compliance and keyboard navigation

digital-experience-healthcare/styles.css.overview: The CSS defines a responsive, accessible, and theme-aware layout for a healthcare digital experience frontend. It includes base resets, typography, layout utilities, grid systems, hero sections, banners, cards, and accessibility helpers. Design tokens are implemented via CSS custom properties for light and dark themes.
key_components: Skip link and visually-hidden accessibility utilities
interactions: Hover and focus states on links and buttons
Responsive grid adjustments at breakpoints (640px, 768px, 1024px)
Skip-to-content focus reveal for keyboard navigation
Theme switching via [data-theme='dark']
data_flow: CSS variables propagate theme and design tokens across components
Responsive media queries adjust layout dynamically
Focus and hover states trigger visual transitions
Dark theme overrides root variables via [data-theme='dark']
accessibility: Keyboard focus visible outlines on links and skip links
.visually-hidden for screen reader-only content
.skip-to-content for quick navigation to main content
Color contrast maintained via theme variables
analytics: Potential hooks for tracking theme toggles
test_ideas: Verify skip-to-content link appears on keyboard focus and navigates correctly
Validate responsive grid layouts at defined breakpoints
Check color and typography consistency between light and dark themes
Ensure focus outlines meet accessibility contrast requirements
Confirm navbar remains sticky and shadow transitions on scroll
Test hover and active states for links and buttons
Validate container max-width and padding adjustments across viewport sizes
